GapFillInput.Title: Intentions and wishes
GapFillInput.Instruction:
Type the correct forms (going to / planning to / 'd like to / 'd rather ) in each gap.
Use the words in brackets ( ) to help you.

Content.Question:
Lucy: What are you planning to do (you / plan / do) after university?
Maria: I'd like to go (I / like / go) to the UK to study English. My sister, Sharon wants to come too.
Lucy: Where would you like to go (you / like / go)?
Maria: Sharon wants to go to London but I'd rather go (I / rather / go) to Cambridge. What about you?
Lucy: I'm going to have (I / go / have) a long holiday and just relax!
Ben: I've got some news. We're planning to move (We / plan / move) to New Zealand.
Jack: No! Really? Why?
Ben: Well, Susan's got a new job. She's going to work (She / go / work) in the National Museum.
Jack: And what about you?
Ben: Well, I'd like to start (I / like / start) my own online company.
Jack: Wow! And when are you planning to leave (you / plan / leave)?
Ben: Probably in the summer but we'd rather leave (we / rather / leave) earlier, next month if possible.
Jack: Well, the best of luck for your future!
Ben: Thanks.
